body.p:
Ohio Circuit Court
The commonwealth of Ky
against } Indictment
Moses Bear

The Grand Jury of Ohio County in the name & by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Moses Bear of the offence of giving loaning & selling to the slave of another, without the written orders of the owen of sd slave or of the person, who for the time being had the legal controll of the service of sd slave. & not having at the time sd slave moreover his controll & not being at the time a physician -- Malt, spirituous & vinious liquors -- committed as follows viz --

The said Moses Bear on the day of May 1862 & on divers days sinse, in the County afsd did give, loan & sell to a Slave. his name to the grand Jurors unknown, but sd Slave belonged then & there to Wm White & who then & there, had the legal controll of the service of sd Slave -- Malt, Vinomous & spirituous liquers -- and without having then & there the written orders of the sd whte or of the person, who then & there had the legal controll of the service of said slave, & the sd Bear, not then & there having sd slave under his controll -- & not then & there being a physician -- against the peace & dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky
Information by -- John Ford -- Thos Moseley, Peter Thomas -- Jno Thomas -- Virgil addington --

A Copy
Attest A, L, Morton clk
Ohio Circuit Court

The commonwealth of Ky
vs } selling LIquors to a slave
Moses Bear
A true Bill -- Jas Leach Foreman of the Grand Jury
Filed March 28th 1863
A. L. Morton clk
A Copy Attest
